00052 #ifndef HEADER_AES_H
00053 #define HEADER_AES_H
00054 
00055 #ifdef OPENSSL_NO_AES
00056 #error AES is disabled.
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 #include <stddef.h>
00060 
00061 #define AES_ENCRYPT     1
00062 #define AES_DECRYPT     0
00063 
00064 /* Because array size can't be a const in C, the following two are macros.
00065    Both sizes are in bytes. */
00066 #define AES_MAXNR 14
00067 #define AES_BLOCK_SIZE 16
00068 
00069 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00070 extern "C" {
00071 #endif
00072 
00073 /* This should be a hidden type, but EVP requires that the size be known */
00074 struct aes_key_st {
00075 #ifdef AES_LONG
00076     unsigned long rd_key[4 *(AES_MAXNR + 1)];
00077 #else
00078     unsigned int rd_key[4 *(AES_MAXNR + 1)];
00079 #endif
00080     int rounds;
00081 };
00082 typedef struct aes_key_st AES_KEY;
00083 
00084 const char *AES_options(void);
00085 
00086 int AES_set_encrypt_key(const unsigned char *userKey, const int bits,
00087         AES_KEY *key);
00088 int AES_set_decrypt_key(const unsigned char *userKey, const int bits,
00089         AES_KEY *key);
00090 
00091 void AES_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00092         const AES_KEY *key);
00093 void AES_decrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00094         const AES_KEY *key);
00095 
00096 void AES_ecb_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00097         const AES_KEY *key, const int enc);
00098 void AES_cbc_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00099         size_t length, const AES_KEY *key,
00100         unsigned char *ivec, const int enc);
00101 void AES_cfb128_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00102         size_t length, const AES_KEY *key,
00103         unsigned char *ivec, int *num, const int enc);
00104 void AES_cfb1_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00105         size_t length, const AES_KEY *key,
00106         unsigned char *ivec, int *num, const int enc);
00107 void AES_cfb8_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00108         size_t length, const AES_KEY *key,
00109         unsigned char *ivec, int *num, const int enc);
00110 void AES_ofb128_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00111         size_t length, const AES_KEY *key,
00112         unsigned char *ivec, int *num);
00113 void AES_ctr128_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00114         size_t length, const AES_KEY *key,
00115         unsigned char ivec[AES_BLOCK_SIZE],
00116         unsigned char ecount_buf[AES_BLOCK_SIZE],
00117         unsigned int *num);
00118 /* NB: the IV is _two_ blocks long */
00119 void AES_ige_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00120                      size_t length, const AES_KEY *key,
00121                      unsigned char *ivec, const int enc);
00122 /* NB: the IV is _four_ blocks long */
00123 void AES_bi_ige_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00124                         size_t length, const AES_KEY *key,
00125                         const AES_KEY *key2, const unsigned char *ivec,
00126                         const int enc);
00127 
00128 int AES_wrap_key(AES_KEY *key, const unsigned char *iv,
00129                 unsigned char *out,
00130                 const unsigned char *in, unsigned int inlen);
00131 int AES_unwrap_key(AES_KEY *key, const unsigned char *iv,
00132                 unsigned char *out,
00133                 const unsigned char *in, unsigned int inlen);
00134 
00135 
00136 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00137 }
00138 #endif
00139 
00140 #endif /* !HEADER_AES_H */
